object.answerExplaination: TCP operates at the transport layer, providing host-to-host connectivity.
object.question: At which layer of the Internet model does TCP operate?

object.answerExplaination: TCP handles handshaking and transmission details, abstracting the network connection for the application.
object.question: What is one of the primary functions of TCP at the transport layer?

object.answerExplaination: TCP detects packet loss, duplication, and out-of-order delivery, requesting re-transmission and re-arranging data.
choices: Detecting and correcting packet loss and reordering
Converting domain names to IP addresses
object.question: What does TCP do to handle issues like packet loss, duplication, or out-of-order delivery?

object.answerExplaination: TCP is optimized for accurate delivery, which can lead to longer delays.
object.question: Which of the following applications is NOT particularly suitable for TCP?

object.answerExplaination: TCP uses positive acknowledgment with re-transmission to ensure reliable delivery.
object.question: What technique does TCP use to ensure reliable byte stream delivery?

object.answerExplaination: The sender re-transmits a packet if the acknowledgment is not received before the timer expires.
choices: In case a packet gets lost or corrupted
To prioritize certain types of data
object.question: Why does the TCP sender maintain a timer for each sent packet?

object.answerExplaination: IP handles the actual delivery of data, while TCP manages the segments.
object.question: Which protocol handles the actual delivery of data, while TCP keeps track of segments?

object.answerExplaination: The internet layer encapsulates TCP segments into IP packets.
object.question: Into what does the internet layer software encapsulate each TCP segment?

object.answerExplaination: TCP re-assembles segments at the destination, ensuring correct order and error-free delivery.
object.question: What does the TCP software in the transport layer do when the client program receives the segments?

object.answerExplaination: TCP is optimized for accurate delivery, which can incur delays.
object.question: TCP is optimized for which type of delivery?

object.answerExplaination: TCP minimizes network congestion to reduce packet loss and other issues.
object.question: What does TCP help minimize to reduce the occurrence of packet loss and other problems?

object.answerExplaination: If data remains undelivered, the source is notified of the failure.
choices: The source is notified of the failure
The data is stored for later delivery
object.question: What happens if the data remains undelivered by TCP?

object.answerExplaination: TCP abstracts the application's communication from the underlying networking details.
choices: Converting domain names to IP addresses
Abstracting the application's communication from networking details
object.question: What does TCP abstract the application's communication from?

object.answerExplaination: Email is one of the internet applications that uses TCP.
object.question: Which of the following internet applications uses TCP extensively?

object.answerExplaination: TCP can incur relatively long delays while waiting for re-transmissions.
object.question: What type of delays can TCP incur while waiting for out-of-order messages or re-transmissions?

object.answerExplaination: RTP over UDP is recommended for real-time applications like voice over IP.
object.question: Which protocol is usually recommended for real-time applications such as voice over IP?

object.answerExplaination: TCP guarantees that all bytes received will be identical and in the same order as those sent.
choices: Bytes may be altered during transmission
All bytes received will be identical and in the same order as those sent
Bytes may be received out of order
Some bytes may be lost during transmission
object.question: What does TCP guarantee about the bytes received?

object.answerExplaination: TCP divides the file into segments for efficient routing through the network.
choices: Sending the file as a single unit
object.question: When an HTML file is sent from a web server, what does the TCP software layer do with the file?

object.answerExplaination: The destination IP address is included in the IP header.
object.question: What information is included in the IP header that is added to each TCP segment?

object.answerExplaination: Network socket interface is used by application to communicate with TCP.
object.question: Typically, through what interface does an application interact with TCP?

object.answerExplaination: Traffic load balancing can cause IP packets to be delivered out of order.
object.question: Which of the following can cause IP packets to be delivered out of order?

object.answerExplaination: TCP requests re-transmission of lost data.
object.question: What does TCP do when it detects lost data?

object.answerExplaination: WWW is one of the internet applications that uses TCP.
object.question: Which of the following internet applications uses TCP extensively?

object.answerExplaination: Streaming media uses TCP.
object.question: Which of the following applications uses TCP?

object.answerExplaination: TCP provides a reliable byte stream delivery service.
object.question: What type of service does TCP provide?

object.answerExplaination: The sender keeps a record of each packet it sends.
choices: The receiver keeps a record of each packet it receives
The network router keeps a record of each packet it routes
The application keeps a record of each packet it sends
The sender keeps a record of each packet it sends
object.question: Who keeps a record of each packet sent in TCP?

object.answerExplaination: The timer is needed in case a packet gets lost.
choices: In case a packet gets lost
To prioritize certain types of data
object.question: Why is the timer needed in TCP?

object.answerExplaination: The internet layer encapsulates each TCP segment into an IP packet.
object.question: Into what does the internet layer software encapsulate each TCP segment?

object.answerExplaination: TCP ensures segments are correctly ordered.
object.question: What does the TCP software ensure when the client program receives the segments?

object.answerExplaination: TCP provides a communication service at an intermediate level between an application program and the Internet Protocol.
choices: Between an application program and the Internet Protocol
Between the operating system and the hardware
Between the user and the application program
object.question: At what level does TCP provide a communication service?

{"generationConfig":{"temperature":0,"responseMimeType":"application/json","responseSchema":{"required":["elements"],"type":"object","properties":{"elements":{"type":"array","items":{"required":["question","choices","answer","answerExplaination"],"type":"object","properties":{"question":{"type":"string"},"choices":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"string"}},"answer":{"type":"number"},"answerExplaination":{"type":"string"}}}}}}},"contents":[{"role":"user","parts":[{"text":"Generate 30 multiple choice questions based 
    on the given context and also follow the instructions given
    <context>The Transmission Control Protocol provides a communication service at an intermediate level between an application program and the Internet Protocol. It provides host-to-host connectivity at the transport layer of the Internet model. An application does not need to know the particular mechanisms for sending data via a link to another host, such as the required IP fragmentation to accommodate the maximum transmission unit of the transmission medium. At the transport layer, TCP handles all handshaking and transmission details and presents an abstraction of the network connection to the application typically through a network socket interface.At the lower levels of the protocol stack, due to network congestion, traffic load balancing, or unpredictable network behavior, IP packets may be lost, duplicated, or delivered out of order. TCP detects these problems, requests re-transmission of lost data, rearranges out-of-order data and even helps minimize network congestion to reduce the occurrence of the other problems. If the data still remains undelivered, the source is notified of this failure. Once the TCP receiver has reassembled the sequence of octets originally transmitted, it passes them to the receiving application. Thus, TCP abstracts the application's communication from the underlying networking details.TCP is used extensively by many internet applications, including the World Wide Web (WWW), email, File Transfer Protocol, Secure Shell, peer-to-peer file sharing, and streaming media.TCP is optimized for accurate delivery rather than timely delivery and can incur relatively long delays (on the order of seconds) while waiting for out-of-order messages or re-transmissions of lost messages. Therefore, it is not particularly suitable for real-time applications such as voice over IP. For such applications, protocols like the Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP) operating over the User Datagram Protocol (UDP) are usually recommended instead.[13] is a reliable byte stream delivery service that guarantees that all bytes received will be identical and in the same order as those sent. Since packet transfer by many networks is not reliable, TCP achieves this using a technique known as positive acknowledgment with re-transmission. This requires the receiver to respond with an acknowledgment message as it receives the data. The sender keeps a record of each packet it sends and maintains a timer from when the packet was sent. The sender re-transmits a packet if the timer expires before receiving the acknowledgment. The timer is needed in case a packet gets lost or corrupted.[13]While IP handles actual delivery of the data, TCP keeps track of segments â€“ the individual units of data transmission that a message is divided into for efficient routing through the network. For example, when an HTML file is sent from a web server, the TCP software layer of that server divides the file into segments and forwards them individually to the internet layer in the network stack. The internet layer software encapsulates each TCP segment into an IP packet by adding a header that includes (among other data) the destination IP address. When the client program on the destination computer receives them, the TCP software in the transport layer re-assembles the segments and ensures they are correctly ordered and error-free as it streams the file contents to the receiving application.  </context>
    <instructions>undefined}</instructions>
